derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : probably imitative of an infant's first attempts at speech. Compare with baby

entry.tran: 宝贝儿（对所爱之人的昵称）
entry.def: Some people use babe as an affectionate way of addressing someone they love.

example.ex: I'm sorry, babe. I didn't  mean it.
example.tran: 对不起，宝贝儿。我不是有意的。

entry.tran: 宝贝儿（对漂亮的年轻女性的称呼，可能具冒犯意味）
entry.def: Some men refer to an attractive young woman as a babe. This use could cause offence.
A babe is the same as a baby.

means.word_mean: 1. a very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk;

means.word_mean: 无生活经验(或知识)而容易轻信别人的人；不懂世故的人

sentences.en: We’re still babes in the woods when it comes to computer technology.
sentences.cn: 说到计算机技术，我们所知甚少。
